unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi reports a spike in stroke cases post Diwali. Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Head of Neurology, says they've seen a 20% increase compared to last month. "Lots of late nights, unhealthy sweets, and stress contributed," he explained. He urged people, especially those with BP or diabetes, to get a check-up ASAP if they notice any symptoms.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi reports a spike in stroke cases post Diwali. Doctor Rajesh Kumar, Head of Neurology, says they've seen a twenty percent increase compared to last month. "Lots of late nights, unhealthy sweets, and stress contributed," he explained. He urged people, especially those with B-P or diabetes, to get a check-up A-S-A-P if they notice any symptoms.

unnormalised: The hospital treated 35 stroke patients in the last week alone. A majority of them were in the age group of 50-65 yrs. Doctors are especially concerned about younger folks ignoring early signs. Remember that FAST mnemonic - Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call for help.
normalised: The hospital treated thirty five stroke patients in the last week alone. A majority of them were in the age group of fifty to sixty five years. Doctors are especially concerned about younger folks ignoring early signs. Remember that F-A-S-T mnemonic - Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call for help.

unnormalised: One patient, Mrs. Sharma from Gurgaon, shared her experience. "Suddenly my left arm felt numb. Initially, I ignored it thinking it's just fatigue. But when my speech got slurred, my son immediately called 102." She got thrombolysis within the golden hour and is recovering well.
normalised: One patient, Missus Sharma from Gurgaon, shared her experience. "Suddenly my left arm felt numb. Initially, I ignored it thinking it's just fatigue. But when my speech got slurred, my son immediately called one hundred and two." She got thrombolysis within the golden hour and is recovering well.

unnormalised: The neurology dept is now running a public awareness campaign. They are distributing pamphlets with info on stroke prevention and early treatment options like tPA. You can also catch their online session on 25/11/2024 at 4 PM IST for more details. Don't take your health lightly, bhai!
normalised: The neurology department is now running a public awareness campaign. They are distributing pamphlets with info on stroke prevention and early treatment options like t-P-A. You can also catch their online session on twenty fifth november two thousand and twenty four at four P-M I-S-T for more details. Don't take your health lightly, bhai!
